newsitem.title: USA: Reliance Acceptance sees return to profit.
newsitem.headline: Reliance Acceptance sees return to profit.

text.p: Reliance Acceptance Group Inc said Thursday it had received an extension to its secured revolving credit agreement and that it believes it will return to profitability in the third quarter.

The company reported a $9.9 million loss in its first quarter and said it expects to post a significant loss for its second quarter because of more efforts to strengthen loan loss reserves during the quarter.
"We believe that Reliance will return to profitability during the third quarter as we feel that we are now adequately reserved and expect charge-offs to decline going forward," the company said.
The company said its credit pact with a group of lenders led by Bank America Business Credit Inc has been extended to December 15.
The company said it needs additional financing sources, including securitizations, to reduce the facility and provide necessary funds to maintain and grow business and earnings.
It said all eight lenders in the consortium will continue to participate in the revised credit pact and that the banks also agreed to waive second quarter covenant defaults under the loan agreement.
